feed.title: Jake Zimmerman | Git
feed.subtitle: A collection of blog posts about programming, software, types, programming languages, Sorbet, Vim, Markdown, and more.

entry.title: Code Review from the Command Line

link.title: Code Review from the Command Line

entry.summary: I do the bulk of my code reviews from the command line, especially when reviewing larger changes. I've built up a number of tools and config settings that help me dig into the nuances of the code I'm reviewing, so that I can understand it better than if I were just browsing online.

entry.title: Noteworthy Dotfile Hacks
entry.summary: Because it's much easier (for me at least) to read a blog post than read the code.

entry.title: New GitHub Username
entry.summary: I've changed my GitHub username! Please update your remote urls.

entry.title: Mastering git log for Collaboration
entry.summary: Mastering git log is probably the best way to collaborate effectively on a project that uses Git.

entry.title: Using Multiple Git Remotes
entry.summary: An overview of how multiple Git remotes can be used to synchronize code distributed in a read-only Git repo
